1 #define DEBUG 0
2 
11 #include <ros/ros.h>
12 #include <image_transport/image_transport.h>
13 #include <cv_bridge/cv_bridge.h>
14 #include <sensor_msgs/image_encodings.h>
15 
16 #include <opencv2/opencv.hpp>
17 #include <opencv2/imgproc/imgproc.hpp>
18 #include <opencv2/highgui/highgui.hpp>
19 
20 #include "bb_improc/argparse.h"
21 
22 
23 
24 int main(int argc, char **argv){
25  // ROS Node init
26  ros::init(argc, argv, "raw_pub_node");
27 
28  // Instantiate node handle
29  ros::NodeHandle n;
30 
31  // Set up image transport publisher
32  image_transport::ImageTransport it(n);
33  image_transport::Publisher pub = it.advertise("frames", 1);
34 
35  // Start OpenCV video capture
36  cv::VideoCapture cap;
37  if(!cap.open(0)) {
38  ROS_ERROR("OpenCV capture failed to open.");
39  return -1;
40  }
41 
42  // Capture convert and publish images
43  int count = 0;
44  while(ros::ok()){
45  // Print some useful info
46  std::stringstream info;
47  info << "Publishing frame: " << count++;
48  ROS_INFO("%s", info.str().c_str());
49 
50  // Get OpenCV frame
51  cv::Mat frame;
52 
53  cap >> frame;
54  if (frame.empty()){
55  ROS_INFO("Camera frame empty, exiting.");
56  return 0;
57  }
58 
59  #if DEBUG
60  // If we're in debug mode allow the node to create a
61  // video window.
62  cv::imshow("Publisher - Video", frame);
63  if (cv::waitKey(10) == 27) break;
64  #endif
65 
66  // Convert to sensor_msgs/Image
67  sensor_msgs::ImagePtr img_msg =
68  cv_bridge::CvImage(std_msgs::Header(), "bgr8", frame).toImageMsg();
69 
70  // Publish our camera image - want to publish them as frequently as we can.
71  pub.publish(img_msg);
72  }
73 
74  return 0;
75 }
main
int main(int argc, char **argv)
